nodes.name: project
nodes.description: Any specifically defined piece of work that is undertaken or attempted to meet a single requirement. (NCIt C47885)

properties.name: name
properties.description: Display name/brief description for the project.

properties.name: code
properties.description: Unique identifier for the project.

properties.name: availability_type
properties.description: Is the project open or restricted?

properties.name: released
properties.description: To release a project is to tell the GDC to include all submitted entities in the next GDC index.

properties.name: releasable
properties.description: A project can only be released by the user when `releasable` is true.

properties.name: intended_release_date
properties.description: Tracks a Project's intended release date.

properties.name: dbgap_accession_number
properties.description: The dbgap accession number provided for the project.

properties.name: title
properties.description: The title of the clinical study, corresponding to the title of the protocol.

properties.name: brief_summary
properties.description: A short description of the clinical study, including a brief statement of the clinical study's hypothesis, written in language intended for the lay public.

properties.name: data_type
properties.description: The general classification of the approach used for the study, i.e. GSA, GDA, RNA-seq.

properties.name: estimated_study_completion
properties.description: The estimated date that the study will be completed/published.

properties.name: description
properties.description: Extended description of the protocol, including more technical information, if desired. Do not include the entire protocol; do not duplicate information recorded in other data elements, such as Eligibility Criteria or outcome measures.

properties.name: category
properties.description: The nature of the investigation or investigational use for which clinical study information is being submitted.

properties.name: study_phase
properties.description: For a clinical trial of a drug product (including a biological product), the numerical phase of such clinical trial, consistent with terminology in 21 CFR 312.21 and in 21 CFR 312.85 for phase 4 studies.

properties.name: study_design_allocation
properties.description: The method by which participants are assigned to arms in a clinical trial.

properties.name: study_design_intervention_model
properties.description: The strategy for assigning interventions to participants.

properties.name: study_design_masking
properties.description: The party or parties involved in the clinical trial who are prevented from having knowledge of the interventions assigned to individual participants.

properties.name: study_design_primary_purpose
properties.description: The main objective of the intervention(s) being evaluated by the clinical trial.

properties.name: intervention_type
properties.description: For each intervention studied in the clinical study, the general type of intervention.

properties.name: creator
properties.description: An organization that initiates the investigation and is legally responsible for the study.

properties.name: collaborators
properties.description: Other organizations (if any) providing support. Support may include funding, design, implementation, data analysis or reporting. The responsible party is responsible for confirming all collaborators before listing them.

properties.name: principle_investigator
properties.description: A researcher in a study who oversees multiple aspects of the study, such as concept development, protocol writing, protocol submission for IRB approval, participant recruitment, informed consent, data collection, analysis, interpretation and presentation.

properties.name: prs_account
properties.description: The account in the Protocol Registration and Results System that was used to register the clinical study and to submit results information for the registered study.

properties.name: verification_date
properties.description: The date on which the responsible party last verified the clinical study information in the entire ClinicalTrials.gov record for the clinical study, even if no additional or updated information is being submitted.

properties.name: clinical_trial_website
properties.description: Any originating or affiliated website for the respective clinical trial.

properties.name: contributor
properties.description: An entity responsible for making contributions to the resource. Examples of a Contributor include a person, an organization, or a service. Typically, the name of a Contributor should be used to indicate the entity.

properties.name: coverage
properties.description: The spatial or temporal topic of the resource, the spatial applicability of the resource, or the jurisdiction under which the resource is relevant. Spatial topic and spatial applicability may be a named place or a location specified by its geographic coordinates. Temporal topic may be a named period, date, or date range. A jurisdiction may be a named administrative entity or a geographic place to which the resource applies. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Thesaurus of Geographic Names [TGN] (http://www.getty.edu/research/tools/vocabulary/tgn/index.html). Where appropriate, named places or time periods can be used in preference to numeric identifiers such as sets of coordinates or date ranges.

properties.name: language
properties.description: A language of the resource. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as RFC 4646 (http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc4646.txt).

properties.name: publisher
properties.description: An entity responsible for making the resource available. Examples of a Publisher include a person, an organization, or a service. Typically, the name of a Publisher should be used to indicate the entity.

properties.name: rights
properties.description: Information about rights held in and over the resource. Typically, rights information includes a statement about various property rights associated with the resource, including intellectual property rights.

properties.name: source
properties.description: A related resource from which the described resource is derived. The described resource may be derived from the related resource in whole or in part. Recommended best practice is to identify the related resource by means of a string conforming to a formal identification system.

properties.name: project.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'project' table.

nodes.name: project_metadata
nodes.description: Data file containing the metadata for the project.

properties.name: data_category
properties.description: Broad categorization of the contents of the data file.

properties.name: data_type
properties.description: Specific content type of the data file.

properties.name: data_format
properties.description: Format of the data files.

properties.name: project.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'project' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'project_metadata' table.

properties.name: file_name
properties.description: The name (or part of a name) of a file (of any type).

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: The size of the data file (object) in bytes.

properties.name: md5sum
properties.description: The 128-bit hash value expressed as a 32 digit hexadecimal number used as a file's digital fingerprint.

properties.name: object_id
properties.description: The GUID of the object in the index service.

properties.name: project_metadata.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'project_metadata' table.

properties.description: The indvidiual or group being acknowledged by the project.

nodes.name: demographic
nodes.description: Data for the characterization of the participant by means of segmenting the population (e.g., characterization by age, sex, or race).

properties.name: gender
properties.description: Text designations that identify gender. Gender is described as the assemblage of properties that distinguish people on the basis of their societal roles. [Explanatory Comment 1: Identification of gender is based upon self-report and may come from a form, questionnaire, interview, etc.]

properties.name: race
properties.description: An individual's self-reported racial classification. The provided values are based on categories used by the U.S. Census Bureau, but have been augmented to distinguish further between Asian and Middle-Eastern groups.

properties.name: race_other
properties.description: Racial designation not matching one of the enumerated racial categories.

properties.name: hispanic
properties.description: Whether a participant describes him or herself as Hispanic or Latino.

properties.name: jewish
properties.description: Whether a participant describes him or herself as Jewish.

properties.name: year_of_birth
properties.description: Numeric value to represent the calendar year in which an individual was born.

properties.name: birth_order
properties.description: Birth order

properties.name: paternal_grandfather_jewish
properties.description: Is paternal grandfather Jewish?

properties.name: paternal_grandmother_jewish
properties.description: Is paternal grandmother Jewish?

properties.name: maternal_grandfather_jewish
properties.description: Is maternal grandfather Jewish?

properties.description: Is maternal grandmother Jewish?

properties.description: Is paternal grandfather Ashkenazi (Jewish)?

properties.name: maternal_grandfather_ashkenazi
properties.description: Is maternal grandfather Ashkenazi (Jewish)?

properties.name: maternal_grandmother_ashkenazi
properties.description: Is maternal grandmother Ashkenazi (Jewish)?

properties.name: breast_fed
properties.description: Breast fed?

properties.name: duration_of_exclusive_breastfeeding
properties.description: If breast fed, duration of exclusive breastfeeding (months)?

properties.name: age_at_weaning
properties.description: Age at weaning (months)

properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'participant' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'demographic' table.

properties.name: demographic.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'demographic' table.

nodes.name: alias
nodes.description: Additional identifier by which the participant is known.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Identifier referring to an individual participant. This may consist of a single alphanumeric value, or a pair of values representing the family/pedigree and individual, separated by a comma.

properties.name: participant.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'participant' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'alias' table.

properties.name: alias.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'alias' table.

nodes.name: visit
nodes.description: A visit by a patient or study participant to a medical professional. A clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures and assessments that may be performed on a participant. A visit has a start and an end, each described with a rule. The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained before and after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.

properties.name: age_at_visit
properties.description: Age at visit in years - round to nearest integer. If the age in years at the visit is greater than 89, see 'age_at_visit_gt89'.

properties.name: bmi
properties.description: The body mass divided by the square of the body height expressed in units of kg/m^2.

properties.name: ever_transferred
properties.description: Participant ever transferred sites (changed ids)

properties.name: health_insurance
properties.description: Currently have any health insurance

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the patient in meters.

properties.name: pregnancy_status
properties.description: Is the participant pregnant (women) or has been pregnant since the last visit

properties.name: review_yr
properties.description: Year in which the subject's phenotype data were last updated. Must be greater than or equal to both yob and diag_yr.

properties.name: version_data
properties.description: Version number of data

properties.name: visit_number
properties.description: Visit number

properties.name: harmonized_visit_number
properties.description: The derived harmonized visit number for the studies MACS and WIHS.

properties.name: visit_type
properties.description: Define if the visit is a follow-up or the baseline visit.

properties.name: weight
properties.description: The weight of the participant measured in grams.

properties.name: weight_percentage
properties.description: The percentage of the weight considering the weight measured at the index date as the reference.

properties.name: visit_date
properties.description: Year of the visit.

properties.name: days_to_follow_up
properties.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the patient was seen or contacted at follow-up.

properties.name: visit_id
properties.description: ID at time of interview (prior to transfer)

properties.name: participant.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'participant' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'visit' table.

properties.name: visit.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'visit' table.

nodes.name: sample
nodes.description: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

properties.name: biospecimen_anatomic_site
properties.description: Text term that represents the name of the primary disease site of the submitted tumor sample.

properties.name: composition
properties.description: Text term that represents the cellular composition of the sample.

properties.name: days_to_collection
properties.description: Time interval from the date of biospecimen collection to the date of initial pathologic diagnosis, represented as a calculated number of days.

properties.name: method_of_sample_procurement
properties.description: The method used to procure the sample used to extract analyte(s).

properties.name: preservation_method
properties.description: Text term that represents the method used to preserve the sample.

properties.name: sample_type
properties.description: Characterization of the sample as either clinical or contrived.

properties.name: tissue_type
properties.description: Text term that represents a description of the kind of tissue collected with respect to disease status or proximity to tumor tissue.

properties.name: participant.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'participant' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'sample' table.

properties.name: visit.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'visit' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'sample' table.

properties.name: sample.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'sample' table.

nodes.name: aliquot
nodes.description: Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight.

properties.name: aliquot_quantity
properties.description: The quantity in micrograms (ug) of the aliquot(s) derived from the analyte(s) shipped for sequencing and characterization.

properties.name: aliquot_volume
properties.description: The volume in microliters (ml) of the aliquot(s) derived from the analyte(s) shipped for sequencing and characterization.

properties.name: amount
properties.description: Weight in grams or volume in mL.

properties.name: analyte_isolation_batch_id
properties.description: Nucleic acid isolation batch ID

properties.name: analyte_isolation_method
properties.description: Type of nucleic acid isolation batch

properties.name: analyte_isolation_date
properties.description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]

properties.name: analyte_type
properties.description: Text term that represents the kind of molecular specimen analyte.

properties.name: concentration
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the concentration of an analyte or aliquot extracted from the sample or sample portion, measured in milligrams per milliliter.

properties.name: exclude
properties.description: Samples flagged for removal from analysis

properties.name: exclusion_criteria
properties.description: Additional remarks about flagged samples

properties.name: experiment_batch_id
properties.description: Genotype or expression batch ID

properties.name: experiment_date
properties.description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]

properties.name: experimental_strategy
properties.description: Type of genotype or expression batch

properties.name: sample.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'sample' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'aliquot' table.

properties.name: aliquot.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'aliquot' table.

nodes.name: sample_id
nodes.description: Additional ID used to identify sample.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Alphanumeric value identifying an individual sample.

properties.name: sample.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'sample' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'sample_id' table.

properties.name: sample_id.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'sample_id' table.

properties.description: Submitter-defined name for the experiment.

properties.description: Name of the center that provided the sequence files.

properties.name: sequencing_date
properties.description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]

properties.name: platform
properties.description: Name of the platform used to obtain data.

properties.name: instrument_model
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the sample dimension that is greater than the shortest dimension and less than the longest dimension, measured in millimeters.

properties.name: library_strategy
properties.description: Library strategy.

properties.name: RIN
properties.description: A numerical assessment of the integrity of RNA based on the entire electrophoretic trace of the RNA sample including the presence or absence of degradation products.

properties.name: flow_cell_barcode
properties.description: Flow Cell Barcode.

properties.description: Spike-in included?

properties.description: Catalog of Library Preparation Kit

properties.description: Format of the data files.

properties.description: Information on the tools/softwares to generate the annotated VCF file.

properties.description: Description of filters that have been applied to the variants.

properties.name: reference
properties.description: The reference genome used to generate the VCF file.

properties.description: A list of IDs for the contiguous DNA sequences that appear in the reference genome used to produce VCF files.

properties.name: command

properties.description: The 128-bit hash value expressed as a 32 digit hexadecimal number used as a file's digital fingerprint.
